meanings.definition: Native or restricted to a certain region or environment.
meanings.sent1: The endemic species of birds in this forest are unique to this area.
meanings.sent2: The red fox is an endemic animal to the mountains of this region.
meanings.sent3: It's like the forest has its own special club for endemic creatures.
meanings.sent4: The endemic plants cling to the rocky cliffs like nature's secret garden.
meanings.sent5: The endemic butterflies fluttered around, painting the air with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Commonly found in a particular area or population.
meanings.sent1: The flu virus is endemic in schools during the winter months.
meanings.sent2: The endemic flowers bloom every spring in the neighborhood gardens.
meanings.sent3: It seems like the endemic colds have decided to make our office their home.
meanings.sent4: Laughter was endemic among the children, echoing through the playground.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread baking was endemic to the bakery, drawing in customers.

meanings.definition: Belonging exclusively or confined to a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The endemic traditions of the tribe have been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent2: The endemic language spoken in the village is unique and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The endemic fashion style of the town was a mix of vintage and modern.
meanings.sent4: His love for the endemic music of the region was evident in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: The endemic art displayed in the gallery captured the essence of the local culture.
